properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 9:08PM CST until January 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...

Patoka River near Princeton

.Recent heavy rainfall over the Patoka River basin has caused river
levels to rise. Minor flooding is occurring at Princeton, and moderate
flooding is forecast to develop late Tuesday. A crest around 21.7 feet
is forecast for Saturday evening.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Patoka River near Princeton.
* until Wednesday January 22.
* At  8:45 PM Monday the stage was 19.6 feet.
* Flood Stage is 18.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near 21.7 feet by
Saturday evening. The river will fall below flood stage Wednesday
early afternoon.
* Impact...At 22.0 Feet...Flooding affects mainly farmland. Seasonal
camping trailers closest to the river become inundated.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
